newsitem.title: VIETNAM: Hanoi says table-tennis star is no refugee.
newsitem.headline: Hanoi says table-tennis star is no refugee.

text.p: Hanoi said on Thursday that a Vietnamese table-tennis champion reported to be seeking political asylum in Australia had no grounds to do so.

A foreign ministry spokesman told journalists at a news briefing that 18-year-old Tran Mai Trinh's selection as a member of the national table tennis team proved she was not facing persecution in Vietnam.

Trinh was in Vietnam's team during the recent world championships in Sydney. According to Australian news reports, she lodged an application for refugee status on September 27, shortly before her teammates returned to Vietnam.
The spokesman said Vietnam's foreign ministry was checking news reports which said Trinh's father has been serving a prison sentence for the last four years.
